task-wr.title: Adding Hosts Using the host-add Command
task-wr.shortdesc: You can add hosts to the system inventory using the command line.

context.p: US62814 new topicThere are several ways to add hosts to Titanium Server; for an overview, see . Instead of powering up each host and then defining its personality and other characteristics interactively, you can use the system host-add command to define hosts before you power them up. This can be useful for scripting an initial setup.

note.p: CGTS-3053 added noteOn systems that use static IP address assignment on the management network, new hosts must be added to the inventory manually and assigned an IP address using the system host-add command. If a host is not added successfully, the host console displays the following message at power-on:This system has been configured with static management and infrastructure IP address allocation. This requires that the node be manually provisioned in System Inventory using the 'system host-add' CLI, GUI, or sysinv-api equivalent.

step.cmd: With controller-0 running, start the host.

info.p: The host is booted and configured with a personality.

postreq.p: After adding the host, you must provision it according to the requirements of the personality. For more information, see .
